cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi NW of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north-northeast today, make landfall in Florida’s Big Bend Monday, then accelerate northeastward along/just offshore the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coast before moving into the open Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: None at Wilmington; current watch area limited to Florida Gulf coast (Indian Pass to Englewood).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, northern Florida, coastal GA/SC/NC, and portions of the Mid-Atlantic coast including Delaware and New Jersey.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (3%) of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely winds 20–30 mph with higher gusts Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Delaware Bay due to offshore track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to heavy rain possible Wednesday; 1–2 inches expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Delaware and New Jersey beaches.
